intro: Canthium fanshawei, commonly known as the Chinese spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
